title: [K-12] Problem-Based Collaborative Learning for Developing Linguistic Literacy and Reasoning Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific concepts (hypothesis formulation, variable control) and university-level language proficiency (grammar, vocabulary, text analysis basics, foundational pragmatic analysis).
context.additional_context: A graduate-level language program conducting project-based assessments in a technology-limited environment (primarily smartphones). It emphasizes learners' reading comprehension (text structure analysis) and expressive skills (research question formulation), with a focus on analyzing digital language phenomena (experimental design, evidence collection).

learning_goals: Learners can systematically observe complex linguistic data (text/audio) to generate scientific hypotheses and analyze relationships between variables.

Learners can perform the process of collecting, categorizing, and critically evaluating linguistic evidence through collaborative problem-solving with peers and conduct mutual assessments based on a 5-point rubric.

Learners can observe three or more real-world linguistic phenomena (e.g., dialect use, neologism creation, pragmatic variation), generate one or more research questions per phenomenon, and achieve problem definition and question-generation skills with an average of 4 or higher on a 5-point rubric through peer evaluation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
